text:
<@U7WV8C5LN> that should only apply if you already had content at the domain level. 

the domain level ones override the global.

Not saying there isn’t a bug there, just stating the the expected behavior
I'm having problems in chrome getting the HubSpot icon/menu on HubSpot pages. In firefox it shows up and I have a lot less errors in the console. I'll post the difference
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F9JLAT03S/image.png|Firefox console, with working HubSpot sproket icon on website page>
NEvermind. Ghostry said it wasn't "on" but it was after reading the console messages
so what exactly does ghostery do? I get from previous posts that it prevents your ip from being tracked, but what does it do to pull that off?

ghostery allows you to prevent certain scripts from firing. So if you block adwords and HubSpot, those scripts error out and never fire, so the content that would show wouldn't on that webpage, or across anyone
<https://imgur.com/a/VaxjI>
Here is an example of how you can check and uncheck the trackers that are happening on the site
hmm, interesting. Might give that a try. We probably don’t make enough of an effort to prevent our actions from muddying the analytics.
Oh yea I can see the idea behind it now. I don't know why I expected it to work via all domains must've been too early morning :smile:
You would be surprised.

Is there a way to disable domain stylesheets for a blog?  Trying to roll out a new site design on an existing site and I've got a bunch of conflicting styles on the blog.  For all the new pages I've got stage, I've been able to disable domain stylesheets at the page level.  I'd love to be able to do something similar for the new blog I'm working on.
Nevermind... I just blocked the offending stylesheet in devtools
you can disable domain stylesheets when editing the blog in content settings I think. Also it can be done at the template level too
I don't believe you can do it at the template level with a coded template.  Not seeing any option to disable domain stylesheets in content settings.  Any tips on where to look?

valid. Sorry I generally build the drag n drop templates, and just use coded ones for advanced features. Under the actions dropdown is there anything like “head” or “settings” on a coded template? might be there

maybe you can try to overwrite before the user_head_overrides & required_head_tags ? 
something like: 
{% set site_settings.enable_domain_stylesheets = false %} (didn't checked)
where can you override the favicon for the blog?
In the blog template you can add it below after you insert
after the head includes and just add the meta there is how I overrode that
or maybe you have to do it above
I feel like you should be able to overwrite this in content settings like you can on pages. I mean I have it on all domains to have this but i think it only takes for the web/landing pages
This is great stuff.  I'll give it a shot.  Thanks everyone!

no styling h tags is simple enough and wouldn't be a big thing to keep in mind for future builds... i'm just thinking about the 100+ sites we've launched over the last couple years failing compliance because of the h tag order. i don't see why going from an h1 tag to an h3 tag for example makes something less accessible
